properties.name: action.destructive_requires_name
properties.comment: Require explicit names when deleting indices

properties.name: num.network.threads
properties.comment: The number of threads that the server uses for receiving requests from the network and sending responses to the network

properties.name: num.io.threads
properties.comment: The number of threads that the server uses for processing requests, which may include disk I/O

properties.name: socket.send.buffer.bytes
properties.comment: The send buffer (SO_SNDBUF) used by the socket server

properties.name: socket.receive.buffer.bytes
properties.comment: The receive buffer (SO_RCVBUF) used by the socket server

properties.name: socket.request.max.bytes
properties.comment: The maximum size of a request that the socket server will accept (protection against OOM)

properties.name: num.partitions
properties.comment: The default number of log partitions per topic. More partitions allow greater parallelism for consumption, but this will also result in more files across the brokers.

properties.name: log.retention.hours
properties.comment: The minimum age of a log file to be eligible for deletion due to age

properties.name: calculator.rpc.numRetries
properties.comment: Number of times to retry before an RPC task gives up. An RPC task will run at most times of this number.

properties.name: calculator.rpc.retry.wait
properties.comment: Duration for an RPC ask operation to wait before retrying.

properties.name: calculator.scheduler.mode
properties.comment:
The scheduling mode between jobs submitted to the same calculatorContext. 
Can be FIFO or FAIR. FAIR Seem not to work well with mesos

properties.name: calculator.locality.wait
properties.comment: How long to wait to launch a data-local task before giving up and launching it on a less-local node.

properties.name: calculator.dynamicAllocation.executorIdleTimeout
properties.comment:
If dynamic allocation is enabled and an executor has been idle for more than this duration, the executor will be removed. 
 (Caution here : small values cause issues. I have executors killed with 10s for instance)

properties.name: calculator.dynamicAllocation.cachedExecutorIdleTimeout
properties.comment:
If dynamic allocation is enabled and an executor which has cached data blocks has been idle for more than this duration, the executor will be removed. 
 (Caution here : small values cause issues. I have executors killed with 10s for instance)

properties.name: calculator.executor.memory
properties.comment:
Defining default calculator executor memory allowed by Eskimo Memory Management (found in topology). 
USE [ESKIMO_DEFAULT] to leave untouched or e.g. 800m, 1.2g, etc.
